channel.title: [Help] Configuring X in Arch
channel.description:
Hey, as most of you know im pretty much a retard, anyways ive fresh installed arch, installed and configured most packages I want.
I've installed KDE, but I can't run it because every time I start X, the screen goes black and has a white square on the top left, saying [root@ryan currentDir] etc. I never had this problem on my old PC (ran slackware), so I have no idea how to fix. I configured X through X -configure and, according to the arch wiki, thats pretty much all I need to do. Any help is appreciated, I would post my conf but its kinda a pain from the terminal.
Thanks.

item.title: [Help] Configuring X in Arch
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I don’t know about Arch specifically, but here on debian so X11 knows what display manager to start up it is specified in a file:

mopar@debian:~$ cat /etc/X11/default-display-manager /usr/bin/kdm

You might have to adjust some paths, like finding kdm with ‘which kdm’, but the text file (/etc/X11/default-display-manager) should probably be in the same location. Is it?
